title: AI Security Startup depthfirst Secures $40M Series A to Combat Escalating AI-Powered Cyber Threats
body: BitcoinWorld AI Security Startup depthfirst Secures $40M Series A to Combat Escalating AI-Powered Cyber Threats In a significant move that highlights the escalating arms race in cybersecurity, AI security firm depthfirst announced a $40 million Series A funding round on Wednesday, positioning the startup at the forefront of defense against increasingly sophisticated AI-powered cyber attacks. The substantial investment, led by Accel Partners with participation from SV Angel, Mantis VC, and Alt Capital, signals growing venture capital confidence in AI-native security solutions as organizations worldwide grapple with threats that evolve at machine speed. AI Security Startup depthfirst Raises $40 Million in Series A Round Founded just months ago in October 2024, depthfirst has rapidly emerged as a notable player in the competitive cybersecurity landscape. The company’s rapid funding achievement reflects the urgent market demand for solutions that can match the pace of AI-driven threats. According to cybersecurity analysts, the traditional security paradigm has become increasingly inadequate against attacks that leverage artificial intelligence for automation, adaptation, and scale. Depthfirst’s platform, called General Security Intelligence, represents a fundamentally different approach to enterprise security. Rather than relying on signature-based detection or manual analysis, the AI-native suite continuously scans and analyzes codebases and workflows for subtle indicators of compromise. Furthermore, the platform provides comprehensive protection against credential exposures while monitoring threats targeting open-source and third-party components—a critical vulnerability vector in modern software development. The Escalating AI Cybersecurity Arms Race The cybersecurity landscape has undergone a dramatic transformation in recent years. Cybercriminals now routinely employ artificial intelligence to automate malicious processes that previously required significant human effort. These AI-powered attacks range from sophisticated malware generation and hyper-targeted social engineering campaigns to automated vulnerability scanning and exploitation. Consequently, defensive technologies must evolve at a comparable pace to maintain effectiveness. Last November provided a stark warning when Anthropic reported thwarting what it described as the first “AI orchestrated cyber espionage campaign.” This incident demonstrated that AI-driven attacks have moved from theoretical concerns to operational realities. Security experts now warn that defensive systems relying on traditional methods will inevitably fall behind as offensive capabilities continue to advance through artificial intelligence. Leadership with Deep AI and Security Expertise Depthfirst’s leadership team brings substantial credentials from both artificial intelligence and cybersecurity domains. Co-founder and CEO Qasim Mithani previously held positions at Databricks and Amazon, where he witnessed firsthand how automation transforms both defensive and offensive capabilities. “We’ve entered an era where software is written faster than it can be secured,” Mithani stated in the funding announcement. “AI has already changed how attackers work. Defense has to evolve just as fundamentally.” The company’s other co-founders strengthen its technical foundation. Daniele Perito served as director of security and risk engineering at Square (now part of Block), while CTO Andrea Michi brings engineering experience from Google DeepMind. This combination of practical security operations and cutting-edge AI research positions depthfirst uniquely to address the complex challenges at the intersection of these fields. Strategic Allocation of $40 Million in New Capital Depthfirst plans to deploy its newly acquired capital across several strategic areas. The company will significantly expand its applied research and engineering teams to enhance its AI detection capabilities. Additionally, investments in product development and sales will accelerate market adoption of the General Security Intelligence platform. This balanced approach between technological advancement and commercial growth reflects the company’s ambition to establish industry leadership. The funding round follows depthfirst’s development of partnerships with prominent companies including AngelList, Lovable, and Moveworks. These early adopters validate the platform’s practical value in real-world environments. The table below outlines the key investment participants and their roles: Investor Role Notable Focus Areas Accel Partners Lead Investor Enterprise Software, Cybersecurity SV Angel Participant Early-Stage Technology Mantis VC Participant Technology Innovation Alt Capital Participant Emerging Technologies The Broader Implications for Enterprise Security Depthfirst’s funding and technological approach reflect several important trends in the cybersecurity industry. First, security solutions must increasingly operate at the same speed and scale as the threats they combat. Second, the integration of artificial intelligence into defensive systems is transitioning from competitive advantage to operational necessity. Third, venture capital continues to flow toward startups addressing fundamental shifts in the threat landscape. Organizations face mounting challenges as their attack surfaces expand through cloud adoption, remote work, and software supply chain complexity. Traditional security tools often struggle with these dynamic environments. Consequently, AI-native platforms like depthfirst’s General Security Intelligence offer potential solutions through continuous, automated analysis that adapts to evolving threats without constant manual intervention. Comparative Analysis of AI Security Approaches Several distinct approaches have emerged in the AI security sector. Some companies focus primarily on threat detection, while others emphasize automated response. Depthfirst distinguishes itself through its comprehensive platform that addresses multiple vulnerability vectors simultaneously. Key differentiators include: Codebase Analysis: Automated scanning for vulnerabilities during development Credential Protection: Monitoring for exposed authentication materials Supply Chain Security: Continuous assessment of third-party components Workflow Integration: Security embedded throughout development processes This holistic approach recognizes that modern enterprises require integrated security solutions rather than point products that address isolated concerns. Conclusion Depthfirst’s $40 million Series A funding represents a significant milestone in the evolution of AI-powered cybersecurity defense. As artificial intelligence transforms both offensive and defensive capabilities in the digital security domain, startups with strong technical foundations and clear market vision are attracting substantial investment. The company’s General Security Intelligence platform addresses critical vulnerabilities in modern software development and deployment environments. With experienced leadership and strategic capital allocation, depthfirst is positioned to play an important role in helping organizations defend against increasingly sophisticated AI-powered cyber threats that continue to evolve at accelerating pace. FAQs Q1: What is depthfirst’s primary security platform? Depthfirst offers General Security Intelligence, an AI-native suite that helps companies scan and analyze codebases, protect against credential exposures, and monitor threats to open-source components. Q2: Who led depthfirst’s $40 million Series A funding round? Accel Partners led the investment round, with participation from SV Angel, Mantis VC, and Alt Capital. Q3: What experience does depthfirst’s leadership team have? CEO Qasim Mithani previously worked at Databricks and Amazon, co-founder Daniele Perito was director of security at Square, and CTO Andrea Michi was an engineer at Google DeepMind. Q4: How will depthfirst use the new funding? The company plans to hire additional staff for applied research, engineering, product development, and sales to enhance its platform and accelerate market adoption. Q5: What companies are already using depthfirst’s platform? Depthfirst has developed partnerships with several prominent companies including AngelList, Lovable, and Moveworks as early adopters of its security solutions. This post AI Security Startup depthfirst Secures $40M Series A to Combat Escalating AI-Powered Cyber Threats first appeared on BitcoinWorld .

title: Supreme Court Delays Trump Tariff Decision - Bitcoin Rockets Towards $97K
body: The U.S. Supreme Court has declined to rule on one of the most consequential cases on its docket: the challenge to President Donald Trump’s sweeping global tariffs. The decision to delay, without announcing when the next batch of rulings will arrive, has intensified speculation across legal, political, and financial circles as markets brace for what could become a landmark definition of presidential power. The dispute centers on Trump’s expansive use of the International Emergency Economic Powers Act (IEEPA), a 1977 law designed for national security crises, to justify a broad array of tariffs on global trading partners. Lower courts have previously ruled that the current president exceeded his authority in invoking emergency powers to impose tariffs that functioned more like long-term trade policy. During Nov. 5 oral arguments, justices from both the conservative and liberal wings signaled deep skepticism about the administration’s legal rationale. Several questioned whether IEEPA authorizes such a sweeping reconfiguration of U.S. trade relationships without explicit congressional approval, with some references to the “Major Questions Doctrine.” The Trump administration is appealing lower-court rulings that found the tariffs unlawful, and the Supreme Court’s eventual decision is expected to serve as a defining test of the limits of presidential emergency authority. But on Wednesday, the Court decided to remain silent. Missing Trump Tariff Ruling Has Global Stakes The absence of a decision has only added to mounting uncertainty. A ruling against the tariffs would have immediate and far-reaching implications. Analysts warn the federal government could be forced to unwind months of tariff collections, a process Trump has previously described as a “complete mess,” citing concerns about the logistics of refunding hundreds of billions of dollars to importers. Trade economists note that such refunds would be complex but technically feasible, with the Treasury expected to have the funds necessary to process them. Still, the administrative burden alone could create short-term disruptions across supply chains, pricing models, and corporate balance sheets. Beyond the balance sheets, the ruling may reshape long-standing assumptions about executive power. If the Court finds that Trump exceeded his authority under IEEPA, it would send a strong signal that presidents cannot unilaterally overhaul trade policy under the guise of emergency action. Market Reactions: Crypto Rallies In financial markets, the Court’s non-decision triggered a counterintuitive reaction: relief. With no ruling issued and no immediate risk of forced tariff unwinding, investors pushed risk assets higher. Bitcoin rallied sharply following the Court’s release schedule update, soaring to above $97,200 as traders interpreted the delay as a sign that the status quo will hold a little longer. The rest of the crypto market rallied off the development as well, with all of the other top 10 largest digital assets by market cap jumping in the hour after the development. That’s after fear of an adverse ruling had weighed on sentiment in recent weeks. Several macro traders warned that a surprise invalidation of Trump’s tariffs could trigger a period of volatility as markets digested the economic implications, from potential corporate tax adjustments to trade-linked inflation forecasts. Prediction markets, which have been tracking the tariff litigation closely, had priced in a meaningful probability that the Court would strike down Trump’s authority. The absence of a ruling temporarily eased those expectations, though not the underlying uncertainty.

title: Monero (XMR) Pushes to New Highs as Privacy Demand Outpaces Regulatory Pressure
body: The privacy-focused cryptocurrency Monero (XMR) is once again in the spotlight after reaching new record highs, even as governments tighten oversight of digital assets. Related Reading: Dogecoin Bulls Don’t Celebrate Too Early: This Level Still Must Fall XMR recently surged past $700, marking its highest price to date and placing it among the top 15 cryptocurrencies by market capitalization. The rally reflects a broader shift in market behavior, where demand for financial privacy is rising alongside stricter regulatory frameworks across major economies. Currently, XMR is trading near $715, up more than 55% over the past week. Trading activity has picked up sharply, with both spot and futures markets showing elevated volume as traders position around the breakout. XMR's price trends to the upside on the daily chart. Source: XMRUSD on Tradingview Regulatory Pressure Fuels Privacy Demand The latest move comes as regulators in Europe and other regions prepare new rules targeting anonymous crypto transactions. The European Union is expected to ban privacy coins and anonymous accounts by 2027, alongside tighter Know Your Customer (KYC) and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) requirements. Instead of discouraging interest, these measures appear to be driving users toward assets with built-in privacy features. Monero, which utilizes stealth addresses and ring signatures to conceal transaction details, has become a primary choice for users seeking financial confidentiality. Market data indicate that the privacy coin sector has performed well since the broader crypto market downturn in October. While some rivals, such as Zcash, experienced sharp volatility linked to internal governance issues, XMR has absorbed much of the rotation in capital from traders seeking exposure to privacy assets. Leverage And Technical Signals Raise Short-Term Risks Alongside strong spot demand, derivatives activity has increased rapidly. Futures volume has shown repeated “overheating” patterns, suggesting that leverage is chasing price rather than building from long-term accumulation zones. In past Monero cycles, similar conditions often led to sharp swings once momentum slowed. Technically, Monero remains in an uptrend, holding above former resistance in the $500–$520 range, which has now flipped into support. The price continues to form higher highs and higher lows, confirming the broader bullish structure. However, momentum indicators are stretched. The Relative Strength Index (RSI) has climbed into the mid-80s, a level that historically precedes either sideways consolidation or short-term pullbacks. Bollinger Bands are also widening, with price pressing against the upper band, a sign of elevated volatility. Key Monero (XMR) Levels to Watch Going Forward The $715–$717 area remains a major psychological and technical barrier. A sustained break above that zone could open the door toward the $730–$740 range, based on Fibonacci extension levels. On the downside, traders are watching the $650–$620 zone as a potential support area if leverage unwinds. Deeper corrections could test trend support if liquidations accelerate, though the broader structure would remain intact as long as higher lows are preserved. Related Reading: Bitcoin’s New Power Buyers: Companies Bought 3 Times What Miners Produced With increasing regulatory scrutiny and a steady demand for privacy tools, Monero continues to attract attention. While short-term volatility is likely, the asset’s role as a leading privacy coin remains central to its current market position. Cover image from ChatGPT, XMRUSD chart from Tradingview

title: Aster “Human vs AI” Live Trading Competition Season 1 Concludes
body: George Town, British Virgin Islands, January 14th, 2026, Chainwire Human Trader ProMint Claims Championship as AI Demonstrates Superior Risk Control Aster , the high-performance and privacy-focused on-chain trading platform backed by YZi Labs, has announced the final results of its “Human vs AI” live trading competition. Conducted over a two-week period under highly volatile market conditions, the event highlighted a clear contrast between discretionary human trading and AI-driven strategies. While individual human trader ProMint secured the top ranking with positive net profits, the human trading team as a whole recorded an overall ROI of -32.22%, reflecting significant performance dispersion across participants. In contrast, AI agents delivered materially more stable results at the aggregate level, limiting total losses to approximately USD 13,000 and achieving an overall ROI of -4.48% across all participating AI strategies. Trading Insight: Stability vs Asymmetric Opportunity Competition data highlighted a clear contrast in risk behavior between human traders and AI agents. During the event, 43% of human participants were liquidated, while all 30 AI agents completed the competition without a single liquidation, achieving a 100% survival rate. According to Aster, the results underscore the structural strengths of AI-driven strategies in stable, risk-controlled market environments, where systematic execution and disciplined risk management help mitigate large drawdowns. At the same time, the findings also suggest that in market conditions driven by human emotion, rapid market shifts, and nonlinear price dynamics, discretionary human traders with strong judgment and narrative awareness can still capture asymmetric opportunities and outperform purely systematic approaches. Future Competitiveness Lies in Collaboration, Not Replacement Competition data showed that human traders exhibited significantly wider performance dispersion, with individual gains exceeding USD 19,000 and losses in other cases approaching USD 18,000, resulting in higher overall return volatility. Aster emphasized that the “Human vs AI” showdown was designed not to determine replacement, but to clarify evolving roles. AI is becoming a foundational tool for execution and risk management, while human traders increasingly contribute judgment, context awareness, and narrative interpretation in complex market conditions. As a result, Aster believes future competitiveness will be driven by collaboration between humans and AI, rather than direct confrontation. Aster: Using the Market as a Real-World Testing Ground Aster stated that the initial goal of hosting this live trading showdown was to observe how different trading participants behave on the same decentralized infrastructure under real market conditions, rather than relying on backtesting or simulated data. As the decentralized derivatives market continues to grow, Aster will continue to explore infrastructure designs that better serve professional trading needs, enabling strategies, risk management, and execution to achieve higher certainty on-chain. “This was not a competition with a predetermined conclusion, but a starting point,” said Leonard, CEO of Aster, in the post-event summary. “As markets become more complex, traders need more than individual tools. They need integrated systems that can evolve alongside the market.” The Next Trading Showdown Begins on Jan 22 Aster has confirmed that the next live trading showdown will officially kick off on January 22 and take place on the Aster Chain Testnet. This upcoming event will open participation to a newly expanded group of traders, including professional participants from around the world, enabling live competitive trading within Aster’s testnet environment. Additional details regarding competition mechanics, rewards, and participation criteria are available in Aster’s official X competition announcement . About Aster Aster is an on-chain trading platform offering high-performance perpetual and spot trading with MEV-aware trading mechanics, advanced order types such as Hidden Orders, and a protected trading mode, Shield Mode, across multiple chains. Beyond trading, Aster enables greater capital efficiency through Trade & Earn and supports ecosystem growth via Rocket Launch, which connects real traders with early-stage liquidity opportunities. Backed by YZi Labs, Aster is building toward its own Aster Chain and is currently running a multi-stage airdrop and incentive program to support its global community. Users can learn more at the Aster official website or connect with Aster on the official X account . ContactPR & Content ManagerLola ChenAsterlola.chen@asterdex.com Disclaimer: This is a sponsored press release and is for informational purposes only. It does not reflect the views of Crypto Daily, nor is it intended to be used as legal, tax, investment, or financial advice.

title: Gold Holds Record Highs, CoinCodex Sees $5,000 Next
body: As of early Tuesday trading, gold prices edged higher , extending recent gains and holding near fresh highs after a steady advance over the past several sessions. Spot prices firmed during the latest hours after recovering from a brief pullback, with buyers pushing gold back above the mid-$4,400 range per ounce and keeping momentum intact into the new session. Over the past few days, gold has followed a clear upward path despite short pauses. Prices dipped earlier in the week, then rebounded as demand returned, lifting the metal through prior resistance levels. The chart shows higher lows and higher highs forming into mid-January, indicating that gold’s short-term trend remains positive as it builds on gains made since late 2025. CoinCodex Forecast Points to Gold Testing the $5,000 Area CoinCodex projections show gold extending its broader uptrend into early 2026, with the forecast line moving toward the $5,000 per ounce zone. The model reflects continued strength following the steady climb that developed through the second half of 2025, rather than signaling a sharp reversal or breakdown. Gold Price Forecast. Source: CoinCodex On the chart, the projected path rises from the mid-$4,000 range and gradually approaches the $4,900 to $5,000 area. The movement appears uneven, with short pauses and pullbacks built into the forecast. However, those dips do not break the broader upward structure, which remains intact throughout the projection window. Overall, CoinCodex presents gold trading at elevated levels while gradually pushing higher. The forecast suggests consolidation near recent highs before further upside attempts, placing the $5,000 level as a key zone the model expects gold to test as the trend continues into 2026. Elliott Wave Structure Signals Further Gold Upside An Elliott Wave analysis shared by ElliottWaveStrategy outlines a continued upward structure for gold, based on the four hour XAUUSD chart. The count shows gold advancing within a rising channel, with price action respecting higher lows and pushing through successive resistance zones as the pattern develops. Gold XAU/USD, Elliott Wave Chart. Source: ElliottWaveStrategy The chart labels suggest gold is progressing through a late stage impulsive wave, following a corrective phase that held above key support levels. Short term pullbacks appear contained within the broader trend, while the structure points to continuation rather than exhaustion. The marked invalidation level near the mid $4,500 area defines where the current wave count would fail, keeping the focus on trend persistence as long as price holds above that zone. Looking ahead, the projected path on the chart points toward higher targets into the upper $4,700 area, aligned with the upper channel extension and final wave labeling. The Elliott Wave setup implies that recent consolidation represents a pause within the move, not a reversal, as gold continues to trade within a well defined upward framework.

title: Where to Find the Best Football Odds on Crypto Sportsbooks
body: Football betting is one of the most competitive markets in online sports betting. With thousands of matches every week and massive global liquidity, even small differences in odds can significantly affect long-term results. For serious bettors, finding the best football odds is often more important than chasing large bonuses or promotions. As cryptocurrency continues to reshape online wagering, football crypto betting has gained popularity among players looking for better pricing, faster transactions, and fewer restrictions. Crypto sportsbooks operate under different cost structures than traditional bookmakers, which often allows them to offer more competitive odds on both pre-match and live football markets. Understanding where these advantages come from — and how to identify them — is key when choosing a platform for online crypto football betting. Why Football Odds Matter More Than Bonuses Bonuses may look attractive at first glance, but football betting is ultimately a game of margins. Over time, odds quality has a far greater impact on profitability than temporary promotional offers. A difference of just a few percentage points in bookmaker margin can: reduce long-term returns limit value on accumulators make certain betting strategies unviable Many sportsbooks compensate for aggressive bonuses by increasing margins on football markets. This means bettors often pay for promotions indirectly through worse odds, especially on popular leagues and matches. For experienced players, focusing on consistently strong football odds is a more sustainable approach than relying on short-term incentives. How Crypto Sportsbooks Set Football Odds Crypto sportsbooks approach odds setting differently from traditional bookmakers. Because they rely less on banking infrastructure and third-party payment processors, their operating costs are often lower. These savings can be reflected directly in football odds. When betting on football using cryptocurrency, odds are influenced by: lower transaction and processing overhead faster settlement and balance updates reduced exposure to chargebacks and payment disputes more flexible risk management models In many cryptocurrency football betting sportsbooks, crypto is not just a payment method but part of the core betting infrastructure. This allows platforms to price markets more efficiently, particularly on high-volume football leagues and live betting markets. As a result, football crypto betting platforms are often able to maintain tighter margins compared to traditional online sportsbooks — especially during peak match hours. What Makes Football Odds Better on Crypto Platforms Crypto sportsbooks often deliver better football odds because their cost structure and execution model are fundamentally different from traditional bookmakers. With fewer intermediaries and faster settlement, platforms can keep margins tighter—especially on high-liquidity leagues. Key factors that improve odds on crypto platforms: Lower overhead: fewer banking and processing fees allow slimmer margins. Faster settlement: instant balance updates reduce operational risk. Flexible risk models: quicker adjustments during pre-match and live markets. Global liquidity: broader participation can stabilize pricing on popular fixtures. For bettors focused on value, these advantages matter most on mainstream football markets where small margin differences compound over time. Best Places for Online Crypto Football Betting Finding the best football odds isn’t about one feature—it’s about how consistently a platform prices markets across leagues, matchdays, and live action. Below are platforms that stand out for online crypto football betting, each with a distinct profile. Dexsport — Optimized for Transparent Football Odds Dexsport approaches football betting with a decentralized, crypto-native model that prioritizes execution and pricing efficiency. By reducing custodial friction and manual intervention, the platform can maintain competitive odds on both pre-match and live football markets. What stands out for football crypto betting: Lower margin pressure through decentralized execution Stable odds during high-traffic matches Real-time cash-out for active position management No-KYC access for unrestricted participation For bettors who value transparent pricing and real-time control, Dexsport fits naturally into a value-focused football betting strategy. Voltage Bet — Broad Coverage with Crypto and Fiat Options Voltage Bet offers wide coverage of major leagues and international competitions, supporting both cryptocurrency and traditional payments. Odds are generally competitive on popular fixtures, with dynamic pricing across pre-match and live markets. Best suited for: Bettors who want flexibility between crypto and fiat Mainstream football markets with standard bet types A combined sportsbook and casino environment While withdrawals can take longer than on crypto-native platforms, odds remain solid on high-profile matches. BetNow — Simple Crypto Football Betting for Casual Users BetNow focuses on accessibility and ease of use. Football markets cover major leagues with standard odds, making it suitable for recreational bettors who want straightforward cryptocurrency football betting without advanced tools. Best for: Beginner-friendly football betting U.S.-focused leagues and international competitions Lower minimums and simple navigation Live depth is more limited than on larger platforms, but pre-match odds remain competitive for popular games. Boomerang.bet — Developing Markets with Competitive Pricing Boomerang.bet is a newer platform that combines sportsbook and casino offerings with crypto support. Football markets include pre-match and live betting with competitive odds, particularly on major leagues and events. Best for: Players looking for a modern interface and rewards program Mainstream football leagues and accumulators Crypto users comfortable with Curacao-licensed platforms As the platform matures, odds depth and live market coverage continue to expand. Pre-Match vs Live Football Odds on Crypto Sportsbooks Both pre-match and live football betting can offer strong value on crypto sportsbooks, but they reward different approaches. Pre-match odds are typically sharper and more stable. They work best for bettors who: analyze fixtures in advance focus on team news, lineups, and market movement build singles or accumulators with clear pricing expectations Because crypto sportsbooks often run with lower overhead, pre-match football odds can be especially competitive on high-liquidity leagues and popular matches. Live football odds, on the other hand, favor speed and execution. They are ideal for: reacting to momentum shifts capitalizing on in-game events (goals, cards, injuries) managing risk through cash-out during the match On crypto-native platforms, live odds tend to update faster and with fewer interruptions, which can make a noticeable difference during volatile moments. How to Compare Football Odds Across Crypto Sportsbooks Comparing football odds goes beyond checking a single match line. To find consistent value, bettors should look at patterns across markets and matchdays. Practical comparison tips: check odds on the same fixture across multiple platforms compare margins on popular leagues, not niche matches review how often live markets freeze during play test cash-out behavior during active matches Platforms that consistently keep markets open and confirm bets quickly tend to offer better real-world value—even if headline odds look similar at first glance. Conclusion Finding the best football odds is about consistency, not one-off promotions. Crypto sportsbooks often outperform traditional bookmakers by maintaining tighter margins, faster execution, and fewer structural limitations. For bettors focused on football crypto betting, platforms built around cryptocurrency offer a clear advantage—especially when odds quality and long-term value matter more than bonuses. Among the available options, crypto-native models like Dexsport stand out for transparent pricing and real-time market access, while platforms such as Voltage Bet, BetNow, and Boomerang.bet provide alternative approaches depending on betting style and preferences. As online crypto football betting continues to grow, understanding how odds are set—and where real value appears—remains the key to making smarter wagers.

title: Live Sports Betting with Cryptocurrency: Best Platforms for Fast In-Play Crypto Bets
body: Live sports betting has become one of the most popular formats in online sports betting, especially among users who prefer fast decision-making and real-time action. Instead of placing bets before a match starts, players can react instantly to what’s happening on the field — goals, timeouts, penalties, momentum shifts — and lock in live betting odds as the game unfolds. The rise of cryptocurrency has pushed live betting even further. Crypto live betting platforms allow users to place in-play bets without relying on traditional banking systems, offering faster transactions, fewer restrictions, and more flexible access to global sports markets. For many bettors, especially those focused on speed and efficiency, an online crypto betting site is now the preferred option for live sports betting. However, not all platforms are equally suited for fast in-play betting. In live environments, execution speed, odds updates, and latency matter far more than bonuses or branding. Choosing the right platform can be the difference between catching value — or missing it entirely. Why Speed Matters in Crypto Live Betting Speed is the single most important factor in live crypto betting. In fast-moving markets, even a small delay can lead to rejected bets, worse odds, or missed opportunities entirely. Traditional sportsbooks often struggle with live betting latency due to centralized risk management, manual bet approval, and payment bottlenecks. Crypto-native platforms reduce these issues by handling funds and bet execution more efficiently. When balances update instantly and bets are processed without third-party intermediaries, users gain a clear advantage in live betting environments. This is especially critical when betting on high-tempo sports like live football matches, NBA quarters, or NFL drives. Live betting odds are constantly adjusting based on real-time data. Platforms with slower infrastructure may freeze markets, delay odds updates, or void bets placed milliseconds too late. Faster crypto live betting platforms, on the other hand, are designed to keep up with in-play action — offering smoother execution and more reliable odds during critical moments of a match. Best Platforms for Crypto Live Betting 2026 Live sports betting with cryptocurrency puts extreme pressure on platforms. Odds change fast, markets pause without warning, and even a short delay can kill a profitable in-play position. That’s why not every online crypto betting sites is suitable for live betting — especially for football, NBA, or NFL markets. Below are platforms that consistently handle fast in-play crypto bets, stable live betting odds, and real-time execution. They differ in structure, custody model, and target audience — which makes the comparison especially important. 1. Dexsport — Best Overall Platform for Live Crypto Betting Dexsport is built specifically for speed, transparency, and real-time betting control. As a decentralized sportsbook and casino, it removes many of the structural bottlenecks that slow down live betting on traditional platforms. Instead of relying on custodial balances and centralized risk controls, Dexsport processes bets directly through blockchain-backed infrastructure. This makes it particularly effective for fast in-play markets, where timing matters more than bonuses or interface design. Why Dexsport works exceptionally well for live betting: Instant bet execution without custody delays Stable live betting odds even during volatile match moments Cash Out available on all in-play bets, allowing early exits or profit locking No KYC — users stay fully anonymous Multi-chain support with 40+ cryptocurrencies across 20 networks Dexsport covers a broad range of sports for live betting, including football, NBA, NFL, NHL, and horse racing, while also maintaining strong esports markets. The platform is especially appealing to experienced bettors who actively manage positions during matches rather than placing static pre-match wagers. Transparency is another standout feature. Every wager is recorded on-chain, and the public betting desk allows users to observe live bets in real time. Combined with smart contract audits by CertiK and Pessimistic, this creates a level of trust rarely seen in online sports betting. For players focused on speed, control, and anonymity, Dexsport sets the benchmark for crypto live betting in 2026. 2. Stake — Strong Live Betting Interface with Broad Market Coverage Stake is one of the most recognizable names in crypto sports betting and offers a polished live betting environment across both sports and esports. Its in-play interface includes real-time stats, live streaming, and flexible cash-out options. The platform supports over 17 cryptocurrencies and processes deposits quickly, making it suitable for active live betting sessions. Odds are generally competitive, particularly for mainstream sports like football, NBA, and NFL. That said, Stake operates as a centralized platform. While users can bet immediately after depositing, withdrawals require full identity verification, which may be a drawback for bettors who prioritize privacy. Stake fits players who value: Rich live betting visuals and stats A wide selection of sports and niche markets VIP rewards and long-term loyalty programs It is less ideal for those looking for no-KYC crypto live betting. 3. Vave — High-Performance Hybrid for Live Sports Betting Vave positions itself as a fast, modern hybrid sportsbook with deep live markets and strong mobile usability. Live betting is smooth, with hundreds of markets available for top football leagues and solid coverage of basketball and international sports. The platform supports major cryptocurrencies and integrates conversion services, making deposits straightforward. Live odds update quickly, and cash-out is available on many in-play markets. However, Vave leans closer to a traditional sportsbook model. KYC is triggered at withdrawal thresholds, and wagering requirements on bonuses are relatively high, which may limit flexibility for short-term live bettors. Vave is best suited for users who want: Deep live football and basketball markets A clean, mobile-first betting experience A balance between casino and sportsbook play 4. Thunderpick — Esports-Focused Live Crypto Betting Thunderpick is heavily optimized for esports, making it a strong choice for live betting on CS2, Dota 2, Valorant, and League of Legends. In-play esports markets are well-supported, with live streams and frequent market updates. Crypto-only payments keep transactions relatively fast, and the platform avoids fiat-related delays. For esports bettors, Thunderpick often feels more responsive than generalist sportsbooks. Traditional sports are available, but live markets outside esports can feel limited, with fewer stats and slower updates compared to dedicated sports platforms. Thunderpick works best for: Live esports betting with cryptocurrency Players focused on competitive gaming rather than mainstream sports 5. Cloudbet — High-Limit Live Betting for Serious Players Cloudbet is one of the oldest crypto sportsbooks and remains popular among high-volume bettors. Live betting markets cover major sports such as NFL, basketball, tennis, and MMA, alongside full esports support. The platform supports over 30 cryptocurrencies and offers automated withdrawals, often completed within hours. Live odds are stable, and betting limits are higher than on many newer platforms. Cloudbet focuses less on flashy promotions and more on long-term rewards, which may not appeal to casual users but works well for disciplined live bettors. 6. BetOnline — Traditional Sportsbook with Crypto Support BetOnline operates as a classic offshore sportsbook that accepts cryptocurrency alongside fiat. Live betting markets are broad, especially for U.S. sports like NFL, NBA, MLB, and NHL. Crypto deposits are fast, but withdrawals and account verification follow a more traditional model. Live betting features are solid, though less flexible than crypto-native platforms, and cash-out is not available on all markets. BetOnline suits bettors who: Prefer a familiar sportsbook structure Want access to U.S. leagues with crypto payments 7. Voltage Bet — Newer Platform with Integrated Live Betting Voltage Bet combines sportsbook and casino products under one account, offering live betting across major sports and some esports markets. The interface is straightforward and accessible on both desktop and mobile browsers. While the platform supports cryptocurrency, withdrawals are slower compared to crypto-native competitors, and the operator has a shorter track record. Live markets are functional but not as deep as on established platforms. Voltage Bet may appeal to users looking for a simple, all-in-one betting environment, rather than advanced live betting strategies. Live Betting Odds: How Crypto Platforms Compare Live betting odds behave very differently from pre-match markets. During a live match, odds are recalculated constantly — after goals, fouls, timeouts, injuries, or momentum shifts. In this environment, the platform’s internal architecture matters just as much as its margins. Many online sports betting platforms advertise “competitive odds,” but in live betting the real question is not how attractive the odds look — it’s whether you can actually lock them in. What affects live betting odds the most? In crypto live betting, odds quality is shaped by several technical and structural factors: Latency — how quickly odds update after an in-game event Market freezes — how often betting is suspended during action Execution logic — whether bets are accepted instantly or manually reviewed Custody model — centralized balance control vs decentralized settlement When these elements are poorly optimized, bettors face rejected bets, sudden odds shifts, or forced market closures — especially in fast sports like football, NBA, or NFL. Centralized vs Decentralized Live Odds The biggest difference between platforms becomes visible during volatile moments of a match. Feature Centralized Crypto Sportsbooks Decentralized Platforms (Dexsport) Odds updates Often delayed during live action Near real-time updates Market freezes Frequent during goals / key plays Less frequent, smoother flow Bet execution Subject to manual risk checks Automated, on-chain execution Slippage risk Higher during fast events Reduced due to instant settlement Transparency Internal, not publicly visible Bets recorded and verifiable on-chain Centralized platforms protect themselves by freezing markets aggressively. This reduces their exposure but directly impacts the bettor’s ability to react in real time. Decentralized systems, by contrast, rely on transparent execution logic and smart contracts, allowing markets to stay open longer during live play. Why Odds Stability Matters More Than Margins Many bettors focus on headline odds — for example, whether a platform offers 1.92 instead of 1.90. In live betting, this difference is often irrelevant compared to odds stability. If a platform regularly: suspends markets mid-play rejects bets after submission recalculates odds after confirmation then even “better” odds lose their value. Crypto-native platforms built for live betting prioritize execution certainty. Being able to secure an odds line when you click “place bet” is often more important than marginal pricing advantages. Live Odds Across Popular Sports Different sports stress live odds systems in different ways: Football (soccer): frequent momentum shifts, injury time, VAR pauses NBA: rapid scoring runs and short possession cycles NFL: sudden play-by-play volatility NHL: fast transitions and power plays Horse betting: extremely time-sensitive odds near race start Platforms optimized for live crypto betting maintain smoother odds behavior across these formats, while less specialized sportsbooks often struggle during peak action windows. In live betting, odds are not just numbers — they are a reflection of how well a platform handles speed, risk, and transparency. Crypto bettors who understand this tend to gravitate toward systems that prioritize real-time execution over cosmetic pricing. Best Sports for Live Crypto Betting Not all sports behave the same way in live betting environments. Some generate rapid odds shifts every few seconds, while others offer longer windows for analysis and execution. Choosing the right sport — and the right platform — plays a major role in successful crypto live betting. Below are the sports where live betting with cryptocurrency delivers the most value, especially when speed and real-time control matter. Live Football Betting with Crypto Football (soccer) remains the most popular sport for live sports betting worldwide. Matches evolve constantly — goals, cards, injuries, substitutions — and each event triggers immediate changes in live betting odds. Crypto live betting platforms are particularly effective here. Fast execution allows bettors to react before markets overcorrect, especially during: early goals momentum swings late-match pressure phases On well-optimized platforms, live football betting with crypto offers smoother market transitions and fewer interruptions, which is critical during intense in-play moments. Platforms designed for real-time execution handle these conditions better than traditional online sports betting sites. NBA Live Betting with Cryptocurrency The NBA is one of the fastest live betting environments in sports. Possessions are short, scoring runs are frequent, and odds shift rapidly during timeouts and quarter breaks. For NBA live betting, crypto platforms provide two key advantages: Faster bet placement during active play Instant balance updates without payment delays Live betting on point spreads, totals, and player props becomes significantly more efficient when bettors don’t have to wait for deposits or confirmations. This is where crypto-native platforms gain a clear edge. Live NFL Betting with Crypto NFL live betting is driven by discrete, high-impact moments. A single drive, turnover, or fourth-down decision can completely reshape the odds. Crypto live betting works well for NFL markets because it allows bettors to: adjust positions between drives react to injuries or play-calling shifts manage exposure through cash-out during momentum changes Because NFL markets often pause during plays, execution speed between stoppages becomes critical. Platforms with reliable in-play processing offer a noticeable advantage during these short betting windows. NHL Live Betting with Bitcoin and Crypto Hockey presents a unique challenge for live betting. The pace is fast, transitions are sudden, and goals can come with little warning. Live NHL betting with cryptocurrency benefits from: rapid odds recalculations minimal market freezes during power plays quick bet confirmations during momentum swings Crypto platforms that handle real-time data efficiently tend to perform better in hockey than slower, centralized sportsbooks, where frequent suspensions can disrupt in-play strategies. Live Horse Betting with Crypto Horse betting is one of the most time-sensitive forms of live wagering. Odds fluctuate sharply in the moments leading up to a race start, leaving little room for error. Crypto betting platforms allow users to place and adjust bets quickly without dealing with banking delays. For horse racing, this speed can be decisive — especially when placing late wagers or responding to sudden odds movements. Live horse betting with crypto is best suited to platforms that: process bets instantly avoid last-second market locks maintain stable odds close to post time Different sports place different demands on live betting infrastructure. What they all have in common is the need for speed, stability, and execution certainty — areas where crypto live betting platforms continue to outperform traditional online sportsbooks. Conclusion Live sports betting with cryptocurrency is built around speed and timing. When markets move in real time, the ability to place and settle bets instantly becomes more important than bonuses or visual features. Across football, NBA, NFL, NHL, and horse betting, crypto-native platforms consistently handle in-play action more smoothly than traditional sportsbooks. Faster execution, stable live odds, and fewer market interruptions give bettors greater control during live matches. Among the available options, decentralized platforms stand out for live betting. Dexsport, in particular, fits this model by combining real-time execution, transparency, and unrestricted access to in-play markets — making it a natural choice for modern crypto live bettors.

title: Analyst Is Certain That XRP Is Going to the Next Level. Here’s Why
body: Crypto markets often reveal their next major moves through subtle but decisive signals long before the broader public notices. Surges in trading volume , regional market activity, and technical momentum often precede price breakthroughs, highlighting where investor conviction is building. XRP now appears to be entering such a pivotal phase, as key indicators point to a potential acceleration in both demand and price. In a recent post on X, crypto analyst Chad Steingraber highlighted XRP’s emerging bullish setup, drawing attention to both price movement and trading activity. He noted that XRP recently surged to $2.17 on Binance perpetual futures, marking a 5.78% gain within 24 hours and backed by $1.45 billion in global trading volume. Steingraber emphasized that these metrics reflect renewed market confidence following years of regulatory uncertainty, positioning XRP for a potential structural advance. I’m not sure who needs to see this… But XRP is going next level… https://t.co/hKo47rM8U1 pic.twitter.com/s2OwezhuK0 — Chad Steingraber (@ChadSteingraber) January 14, 2026 Trading Volume Reflects Strong Market Conviction Steingraber’s analysis underscores exceptionally high trading activity as a key indicator of bullish sentiment. Notably, South Korea’s Upbit exchange accounted for $87.75 million in XRP volume, representing over 20% of global spot trades. Concentrated regional activity often signals robust local demand, which can act as a catalyst for wider market momentum. High trading volume also attracts follow-on activity from institutional and retail traders. When significant liquidity flows into an asset, momentum strategies frequently amplify the move, creating self-reinforcing price trends that sustain upward trajectory. Regional Market Dynamics Drive Momentum XRP’s performance in South Korea highlights the role regional markets play in shaping global price trends. South Korean investors have historically led trading surges during critical crypto cycles, often triggering cascades in other markets. We are on X, follow us to connect with us :- @TimesTabloid1 — TimesTabloid (@TimesTabloid1) June 15, 2025 Upbit’s dominance in XRP trading demonstrates that this renewed momentum is underpinned not only by technical factors but also by concentrated regional demand. Regulatory Clarity Supports Growth Beyond market activity, XRP benefits from resolving regulatory uncertainty. Years of legal challenges previously suppressed confidence, but as these hurdles diminish, investor conviction strengthens. Combined with active trading and regional adoption, regulatory clarity creates a strong foundation for sustainable growth. Toward the Next Level Steingraber’s observations suggest that XRP is entering a decisive phase where technical structure, trading volume, and regional participation converge. The asset’s strong liquidity and supportive market dynamics indicate that it could surpass prior consolidation levels, potentially triggering a broader upward move. If momentum continues, XRP may capture renewed attention from global investors, driving it to the next level and solidifying its position as a leading crypto asset. body: Key takeaways : Our Aptos price prediction anticipates a high of $5.54 by the end of 2026. In 2028, it will range between $19.33 and $25.91, with an average price of $20.18. In 2030, it will range between $79.95 and $99.65, with an average price of $82.60. The Aptos blockchain has aggressively attracted capital into its ecosystem, with its total value locked ( TVL ) rising above $400 million. Aptos is a high-performance layer-1 blockchain with a mature ecosystem comprising a variety of decentralized finance (DeFi) applications. Aptos network continues to build decentralized applications and tools for developers. But how about APT’s performance? How high will it go? Is APT a good investment? According to the technical indicators, APT is neutral. On the charts, its momentum is positive, and its volatility is rising. The move comes as APTs’ drop slows from 2025’s bear run. Why is Aptos up? Aptos achieved record-breaking on-chain application revenue for two consecutive weeks (Dec 22-Jan 4), peaking at $1.07M daily on Dec 31. This revenue stems from transaction/protocol fees, indicating genuine user activity rather than incentive-driven transactions. Recent news Grayscale added Aptos to its “Assets Under Consideration” list for future investment products on Jan 12, positioning APT alongside major smart-contract tokens like SOL and ADA for potential institutional adoption. How high can Aptos coin go? Per the Cryptopolitan price prediction, Aptos will reach a high of $145 in 2032. Is Aptos worth investing in? APTOS’s design prioritizes scalability, reliability, and upgradeability. It is notable for using the MOVE programming language, developed by Facebook and now META. While the current trend is bearish, predictions paint a different narrative. Note that the predictions are not investment advice. Seek independent professional consultation or do your research. Aptos historic price sentiment APT price history by CoinGecko Aptos raised seed funding in January 2022, led by a16z. Series A funding included Apollo, Dragonfly, Franklin Templeton, and others. Some members previously worked on the Diem blockchain proposed by Facebook. The Aptos mainnet launched in October 2022 with an initial supply of 1 billion tokens. After the launch hype, Apt fell to its lowest in December 2022, at $3.09. A month later, the tables turned, as it peaked at a time high of $19.90 on January 30, 2023. It pumped, partly driven by the NFT market. Collections such as Aptos Monkeys and Aptomingod have attracted more users. On June 6, it fell below its initial listing price and extended the losses in the preceding months. In October, it started correcting, rising as high as $8.47 in November. In 2024, it broke above $10, reaching $18 in March. From April, it reversed, falling below $10. By September, it had fallen as low as $6. It recovered in October, rising above $7.50. It crossed into November, trading at the $8.9 mark, and rose to as high as $13.91. It corrected and traded at $13.24 into December. It later corrected and crossed into 2025, trading at the $8.71 mark. The drop continued into February, and in May, it fell below $5.10. In October, it crossed above $5.30, then assumed a bear run, and by November, it had dropped to $3.21. In December, it reached support levels at $1.70. It maintained the levels into January 2026.

title: Something Is Happening With Bitcoin That I Would Have Never Expected: The BTCO Case
body: Summary BTCO is a spot Bitcoin ETF with a 0.25% TER, liquid, and with externalized custody. It replicates the underlying BTC-USD well net of fees, with a linear performance relative to peers. I am looking with interest at the divergence that has formed relative to the performance of US equities. Especially in a context of prospective monetary expansion: an element that typically works in favor of assets like Bitcoin. From a technical perspective as well, it is trading within a range that, in my opinion, allows risk to be managed strategically. Today something is happening on Bitcoin that I haven’t seen for quite some time. Something that naturally is also reflected in the ETFs that replicate its performance, in this sense also on the Invesco Galaxy Bitcoin ETF ( BTCO ). I am referring to 2 very interesting divergences: the one with the S&P 500 the one with global liquidity. These are 2 elements that can easily be interpreted negatively: as a relative weakness of Bitcoin. And yet, personally, I interpret them positively. And before explaining why … What is BTCO BTCO is a spot Bitcoin ETF , with the objective of replicating the spot price of Bitcoin, net of costs. BTCO - Profile (Seeking Alpha) These amount to an expense ratio of 0.25%, fairly competitive, if one considers a bid/ask prem/disc of -0.02% and a bid/ask spread of 0.08%, a sign of positive liquidity . BTCO - liquidity grade (Seeking Alpha) In this sense, naturally, the number of bitcoins per share decreases over time , even if Bitcoin rises. This is because each Sponsor Fee is paid by selling bitcoin, generating an effect of structural economic dilution and inevitable underperformance vs BTC spot in the long term. BTCO - expense grade (Seeking Alpha) For replication it uses the Lukka Prime Reference Rate ( USD ) mechanism; essentially it has prices aggregated from multiple exchanges to determine a fair value and then the NAV that moves synchronously with the underlying. It then uses an external custody mechanism at Coinbase Custody Trust Company, LLC. Peer comparison For completeness, I’m also sharing my peer table, although I want to point out that, after several comparative analyses, I’ve come to the conclusion that the key decision lever should be fees. BTCO - peer comparison (Seeking Alpha) Specifically, BTCO does not have fees that are clearly higher than peers with larger AUM, such as FBTC in this respect , and IBIT . For this reason, in terms of performance there are no major deviations. To go deeper, I invite you to read here . BTCO - peer comparison (Seeking Alpha) Something is happening that I didn’t expect Those who follow me know that I usually analyze Bitcoin’s performance in comparative terms. I don’t appreciate the maximalist dynamic that sees Bitcoin as “the asset that will save us all no matter what.” Simply, it is an asset that, by following this narrative, is achieving great results, and as an analyst, I simply go along with it. To enter the market through ETFs, in the past I have oriented myself by following two parallels that have always brought me great satisfaction . 1. Bitcoin & S&P 500 Bitcoin, therefore the ETFs that use it as the underlying (in this case BTCO), for me is a high beta solution of the S&P 500 (and of the Nasdaq index). It means that it amplifies rises and falls in the same way as a technology stock (basically). Or rather … this is what has guided my research over the past years. But look at what happened today. BTCO - SPY - price (Seeking Alpha) There has been a strong divergence between Bitcoin and the performance of traditional markets. And this, in my experience, and in my opinion, can be read in 2 ways: A positive gap between prices that will facilitate Bitcoin’s growth. A negative gap that anticipates a collapse of the S&P 500. But let’s move on to the second … 2. Bitcoin and global liquidity Bitcoin has a strength (not so common): it has a limited, or better said, predefined supply . Being therefore a “fixed-supply” asset, and freely accessible, it means that if liquidity in circulation increases, the price undergoes (in my opinion) a natural revaluation. For this reason there is a tight correlation between Bitcoin and money in circulation M2 (as is also the case for the S&P 500). US M2 money supply (ycharts) And it so happens that this is at all-time highs, while the price of Bitcoin instead is declining. Well … in my opinion, this is an important asymmetry to consider. My opinion on BTCO Does it make sense to expect a decline in the S&P 500? Certainly, the “unpredictable” exogenous shock is always around the corner, but if as an analyst I had to simply rely on today’s expectations, I don’t see the reason. Revenues and earnings are expected to grow strongly according to FactSet . S&P 500 revenue growth CY 2026 (FactSet financial data and analytics) In the same way, liquidity is expected to expand on multiple fronts: Fed cutting rates, especially after the DOJ accusations against Powell . The unconditional QE of the US government with Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac . And the resumption of monthly expansions of the Fed’s balance sheet. And if these 2 elements are considered sufficient drivers to describe Bitcoin’s performance (as has been the case in the recent period), I think it is more likely that the gap anticipates potential recoveries by Bitcoin, rather than a contraction of the general market. Risk Naturally, this is a forecast based on two arbitrary, and not absolute, conventions. In the sense that it is assumed that Bitcoin maintains an anchoring to these correlations, simply because in the past it has been so: this also means assuming that market habits never change. But this in itself is inconsistent with the very nature of the market. Just think of when Bitcoin was instead called “digital gold” and reacted positively to systemic shocks and geopolitical risks; which is completely inconsistent with the “new conception” of Bitcoin (the one I presented here). In fact, exactly the opposite would happen. So? The risk is that Bitcoin simply changes its conception. BTCO - price (Seeking Alpha) How do I manage this risk? well, I work on the technical side. BTCO today is in a price range on which I can try to set accumulation strategies with controlled risk. Quite simply, in the area below 50 RSI points within the range and slightly below it, I can try to accumulate a position, to be managed with controlled risk. Conclusion These 2 divergences encourage me to maintain a positive rating (BUY) on BTCO. Why? Looking at the nature of the ETF, I consider it competitive in the market. Looking at intermarket analysis, it seems it can be positively influenced by the S&P 500 and the liquidity boom. Looking at the chart, it is located in an area where I can try to work.

title: Changpeng Zhao questions how X would handle KYC if it becomes a financial platform
body: During a Chinese AMA on Binance Square on January 14, CZ expressed skepticism about how X, formerly Twitter, which is now owned by Elon Musk, will handle KYC as it expands the platform’s capabilities to cover financial features. This aligns with Musk’s desire to see X morph into an “ everything app ” where messaging and financial services like trading and investing happen. Changpeng had shared his opinions on the topic, asking important questions and highlighting reasons he believes could complicate the endeavor. What does CZ thinks about X becoming a financial rail? During the Chinese AMA, CZ shared what he thought about the possibility of X launching on-chain transactions and handling KYC should it expand into crypto trading. During the AMA, CZ pointed out potential challenges X may have with user identification, noting that platforms like Binance Square and Binance rely heavily on strict KYC measures in compliance with regulations and to prevent issues like money laundering. Observers have pointed out in the past couple of days, since the topic started circulating, that X is still just a social media platform and as such would face significant hurdles if it attempts to implement robust KYC. Those hurdles, which mostly have to do with the potential regulatory pressure it will face, could make seamless crypto trading difficult or risky, especially if there are no proper verification processes. Is crypto trading feasible on X? Musk has been nursing an ambition to make X an everything app since he bought the app in 2022. He even shared the ambition on X around that time, claiming that the Twitter purchase would accelerate his goal of creating X, the everything app. Years have passed since then, and now he is looking to make good on his promise by wading into the financial industry by making X support crypto trading. The platform has already become a hub for financial conversations, with Nikita Bier, head of product at X, claiming X as the best source for financial news. “Hundreds of billions of dollars are deployed based on things people read here,” Bier claimed in a post. The biggest and most recent development regarding the topic is the soon-to-launch Smart Cashtags feature that Bier announced was in the works on January 11. The feature is designed to allow users to directly tag exact assets or smart contracts in X post. “We’re building Smart Cashtags that allow you to specify the exact asset when posting a ticker,” Bier wrote. “From Timeline, users will be able to tap them to see its real-time price along with all mentions of that asset. We’re aiming to collect feedback as we iterate toward a public release next month.” The update is expected to lay the foundation that X will build on as it inches towards becoming a hub that merges on-platform financial data and conversation, with live market intelligence. Once the update goes live, any user who taps on a cashtag will get a live, real-time display of prices and charts, access to related discussions, news and sentiment surrounding the tag, as well as on-chain data for the token. This will turn the X timeline into a powerful real-time market dashboard that could ultimately benefit crypto traders and enthusiasts. There is even speculation that the update will provide buy or sell buttons, which could result in in-app trading or redirects to platforms partnered with X. If you're reading this, you’re already ahead. Stay there with our newsletter .
